title: Hull teacher Kevin Shaw jailed for spanking boy's bare bum with shoe
text:
Kevin Shaw, 55, smacked the boy on his bare bum (Picture: MEN Media)

A teacher who spanked a teenage pupil on his bare bum with his shoe has been jailed for 15 months.

Kevin Shaw, 55, had taken the boy into a store room at a Hull school in the 1990s after the child had misbehaved.

He then gave the boy the choice either having his parents called or being spanked on the bum with a shoe, Hull Crown Court heard.

The pupil was then asked if he would rather be hit 10 times over his clothes or five times on his bare backside, causing him to opt for more smacks with his clothes on.

But the court heard he had fallen forward during the spanking and begged Shaw to stop, causing the teacher to offer the lesser amount of blows again.

Shaw then took down the boy’s trousers and pants before continuing, the trial was told.

The incident took place in what is now Winifred Holtby Secondary school, in the Bransholme area of Hull.

The assault took place in what is now Winifred Holtby Secondary school (Picture: Google)

Judge John Thackray QC opened his sentencing remarks by saying he wanted to make it absolutely clear that the incident had nothing to do with corporal punishment.

He told the court he had no doubt the whole incident was a planned pretence for the defendant to see the boy’s genitals and to smack his bare bottom.

Speaking to Shaw, he said: ‘All this was for your sexual gratification’, adding that the teacher aimed to satisfy his ‘perverted desires’.

In a personal letter, the victim revealed how he had lived with shame since the incident and had suffered a breakdown in 2017.

He described feeling ‘powerless at the time’ and said he still had flashbacks more than 20 years later.

The man said that he remembered the physical pain but ‘the humiliation and the indignity was even worse’.

Judge Thackray said Shaw had not shown a ‘shred of remorse’, and told the court he had done something similar with another teenager.

He said the teacher had also sexually propositioned a third teen, but neither of the other cases resulted in criminal charges.

Shaw, of Perth Street West, Hull, was found guilty of indecent assault by a jury.
